contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} '''Charles Edward Peter Neil Wood, 3rd Earl of Halifax''' (born 14 March 1944), known informally as '''Peter Wood''', styled '''Lord Irwin''' between 1959 and 1980, is a British peer and [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician. ==Background== Wood is the eldest son of [[Charles Wood, 2nd Earl of Halifax]], son of [[E. F. L. Wood, 1st Earl of Halifax]], [[Viceroy of India]] and [[Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs|Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs]]. His mother is Ruth Primrose, daughter of [[Neil Primrose (politician)|Neil Primrose]] and granddaughter of [[Archibald Primrose, 5th Earl of Rosebery]], [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Lundy |first=Darryl |url=http://www.thepeerage.com/p2259.htm#i22582 |title=p. 2259 § 22582 <!-- Bot generated title --> |publisher=[http://www.thepeerage.com The Peerage]}}{{Verify credibility|failed=y |date=February 2013}}<!--Lundy is not a reliable source so cite Lundy's reliable source See [[WP:SAYWHEREYOUREADIT]]--></ref> He was brought up in [[Newmarket, Suffolk|Newmarket]] at Swinford Paddocks, educated at [[Eton College|Eton]] and [[Christ Church, Oxford]]. ==Career== As Peter Wood, he unsuccessfully contested [[Dearne Valley (UK Parliament constituency)|Dearne Valley]] as a [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] in the [[United Kingdom general election, February 1974|February general election of 1974]] and the [[United Kingdom general election, February 1974|October general election of the same year]]. In 1980 he succeeded his father in the earldom. Lord Halifax is a non-executive director of [[Hambros Bank]], Vice-Chairman of Christie, Manson & Woods, the European Division of [[Christie's]] international fine arts auctioneers, and a director of Yorkshire Post Newspapers Ltd. Lord Halifax is also a Deputy Lord Lieutenant for North Yorkshire, High Steward of [[York Minster]] and a J.P.<ref>http://www.yorkshire-racing.co.uk/garrowby.htm</ref> ==Family== Lord Halifax married Camilla Younger, of the Scottish brewing family, in 1976. Her first husband, Richard Parker Bowles, is the brother of [[Andrew Parker Bowles]], himself the first husband of the current [[Camilla Parker Bowles|Duchess of Cornwall]]; Lady Halifax and the Duchess were therefore once sisters-in-law.<ref>{{cite web |last=Lundy |first=Darryl |url=http://www.thepeerage.com/p2592.htm#i25913 |title= Camilla Younger |publisher=[http://www.thepeerage.com The Peerage]}}{{Verify credibility|failed=y |date=February 2013}}<!--Lundy is not a reliable source so cite Lundy's reliable source See [[WP:SAYWHEREYOUREADIT]]--> - website thePeerage.com</ref> Lord and Lady Halifax together have two children, a son and a daughter: *James Charles Wood, Lord Irwin (born 24 August 1977), heir apparent to the earldom m. Georgia Clarkson They have issue: ** Hon Rex Patrick Wood, born 12 Aug 2010. ** Hon Audrey Nancy Wood, born 23 Jan 2013. *Lady Joanna Victoria Wood (born 15 Jan 1980) From her first marriage Lady Halifax also has a daughter, named Emma Parker Bowles (born 1974). The Earl and Countess live on the 13,000 acre family estate Garrowby Hall near [[Garrowby]], Yorkshire. Lady Halifax is the national president of [[Macmillan Cancer Support]].<ref>http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/news/features/the_right_ingredients_for_charity_success_1_2589031</ref> ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== *{{Hansard-contribs | mr-charles-wood-1 | the Earl of Halifax }} *{{cite web |last=Lundy |first=Darryl |url=http://www.thepeerage.com/p2259.htm#i22582 |title= Charles Edward Peter Neil Wood, 3rd Earl of Halifax |publisher=[http://www.thepeerage.com The Peerage]}} {{S-start}} {{s-reg|uk}} {{s-bef|before=[[Charles Wood, 2nd Earl of Halifax|Charles Ingram Courtenay Wood]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Earl of Halifax]]|years=1980–present}} {{s-inc}} {{S-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Halifax, Charles Wood, 3rd Earl Of | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 14 March 1944 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Halifax, Charles Wood, 3rd Earl Of}} [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Earls in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]] {{UK-earl-stub}}
